ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, pi ne ńzsé ngie áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔg páʼ pɔ́ ne ńjúʼu yɔ́b nò Ssé, ńne ńdÿɔ́ʼte tsɔ́ shúm, pi kúʼte wɔ́b kúʼte tà pi lâ pɔ̌ zoŋo nò na yɔ́b mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa.
en: Welcome   anyone who is weak in faith,  # 14:1 Rm 15:1; 1Co 8:9–11; 9:22 but don’t argue about disputed matters.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lɔgɔ nò Ssé ńzsé ngie à gyá kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, ngwɔ́ á pfɛ́ yé pfɛ́. Wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńdɔgɔ nò Ssé ńdÿɔ́ʼte tsɔ́ shúm léjÿó, zsé ngie à ge pfɛ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ nzab.
en: One person believes he may eat anything,   while one who is weak eats only vegetables.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gyá kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ ngwɔ́ á pfɛ́ yé pfɛ́, à pɔ́ɔn lékʉ́e nyìŋ gẅie à te pfɛ́ shúm ntsèm wɔ́. Nyìŋ gẅie à te pfɛ́ shúm ntsèm wɔ́, à pɔ́ɔn létúu lɔ̌ʼ nyìŋ gẅie à gyá yé kɔ́ wɔ́, ngwɔ́ á pfɛ́ yé pfɛ́, á nue e Ssé kúe yé yé.
en: One who eats must not look down on one who does not eat,   and one who does not eat must not judge one who does,  # 14:3 Col 2:16 because God has accepted him.  # 14:3 Ac 28:2; Rm 11:15; 15:7

ngiemboon: Ɔɔ wɔ̌ tà ńtúu lɔ̌ʼ ngàŋafàʼ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ? À lɔɔn fʉa nò lo, à te fʉa lo, mbà táfàʼ we zɔ gẅiin légɔɔn. À ge tyé te zóŋe anue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅiin tʉ lélɔg ńtóonte yé.
en: Who are you to judge   another’s household servant? Before his own Lord he stands or falls. And he will stand, because the Lord is able  # 14:4 Other mss read For God has the power to make him stand.

ngiemboon: Áa mbwó tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, á zsé ngie tsɔ́ melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ cʉa metsɔ́, ńgwɔ́ mbwó wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ, á zsé yé ngie melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ. Á zɛ́te ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kwaʼ ńnyɛte ńzsé mmó gie aa ntʉ́m yé ńne ńzsé.
en: One person judges one day to be more important than another day.   Someone else judges every day to be the same. Let each one be fully convinced in his own mind.  # 14:5 Lk 1:1; Rm 4:21

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin tyɛʼte na melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ, à gÿo tyɛʼte púʼu, pɔ́ lélɔg ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Nyìŋ gẅie à gyá kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ ńgwɔ́ à pfɛ́ yé pfɛ́, à pfɛ̌ púʼu pɔ́ lélɔg ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á nue à ne ńnáa ndǎg mbwó Ssé mǒ. Nyìŋ gẅie à piŋ te gyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ḿpfɛ́ pfɛ́ wɔ́, à te pfɛ́ púʼu, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. À giŋé ńne ńnáa yé ndǎg mbwó Ssé.
en: Whoever observes the day, observes it for the honor of the Lord.   Whoever eats, eats for the Lord, since he gives thanks to God;  # 14:6 Mt 14:19; 1Co 10:30; 1Tm 4:3–4 and whoever does not eat, it is for the Lord that he does not eat it, and he gives thanks to God.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ wege te gwaa gwɔ́ wó, á gwɔ́ légÿo mmó gie á poŋo yé wɔ́, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ piŋ ńké te gwaa kwé, á gwɔ́ légʉa ńgÿo mmó gie á ge poŋo yé wɔ́.
en: For none of us lives for himself, and no one dies for himself.

ngiemboon: Pege gwaa gwɔ́ wó, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pege ge gwɔ́ shúm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgwaa kwé, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pege ge gwɔ́ shúm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Púʼu la, pege lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀ lo, mbà pege gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńkwé kwé lo, mbà pege gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: If we live, we live for the Lord; and if we die, we die for the Lord. Therefore, whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Keleto la zɔɔn ńkwé ḿbiŋ ńzím légwɔ́ gie à ge gwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mepfó mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie ée ntʉ̀ntʉ̀.
en: Christ died and returned to life   for this: that he might be Lord over both the dead and the living.  # 14:9 Mt 28:18; Jn 12:24; Php 2:11; 1Th 5:10

ngiemboon: Páʼ áa páʼɔɔn la, gù, mélàʼakɔ́ ɔ̀ gíŋe ńtúu lɔ̌ʼ fɛ̌ gù? Gù jú, mélàʼakɔ́ ɔ̀ gíŋe ńkʉ́e fɛ̌ gú? Pege metsèm zɔɔn ḿbú ńgẅiin léláʼ ńcʉa mvfò Ssé à ŋaga wégè.
en: But you, why do you judge your brother or sister? Or you, why do you despise your brother or sister? For we will all stand before the judgment seat of God.  ,# 14:10 Rm 2:16; 2Co 5:10

ngiemboon: Á nue áa tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé, ńgwɔ́ ngie:
en: For it is written,

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ páʼɔɔn ńgyá ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege wɔ́ɔ, ge láʼ tyé mvfò Ssé, kwàʼ yé zɔ píte ncwò wé na páʼ à kɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo.
en: So then, each of us will give an account of himself to God.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, tà pege gíŋe sele ńtú melɔ̌ʼ mégè. Ammó gie pi gẅiin légÿo, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ pi ge pɔ́ɔn légÿo tsɔ́ mmó gie fɛ̌ gẅi ge kwɔɔnte mǒ, à tsóte yé à gÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: Therefore, let us no longer judge one another.   Instead decide never to put a stumbling block or pitfall in the way of your brother or sister.  # 14:13 1Co 8:13

ngiemboon: N ne ńzsé, tá ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ páʼ n da nnɛ́ na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, ńnyɛte ńzsé ngie atsɔ́ mmó té wó gie á puʼ ssé ńgwɔ́ mmó ncÿǒ wɔ́. Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa ngie ncÿǒ ée na tsɔ́ mmó, mbà á ge gwɔ́ na yé twó ncÿǒ gwɔ́ na yɛ̌ mmó.
en: I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean in itself.   Still, to someone who considers a thing to be unclean, to that one it is unclean.  # 14:14 1Co 8:7

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ cʉa na nò mmó gie ɔ̀ pfɛ́ɛ, ńgÿo mbùm fɛ̌ gù kÿo, mbà ɔ̀ te gíŋe ńgÿo na ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńkwoŋo fɛ̌ gù wɔ́. Te lɔgɔ nò mmó léjÿó, ńgÿo fɛ̌ gù gẅie Keleto la kwé na twó yé kúu pyé,
en: For if your brother or sister is hurt by what you eat, you are no longer walking according to love.   Do not destroy, by what you eat, someone for whom Christ died.  # 14:15 1Co 8:11

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ légÿo mmó gie mé ge cʉa mǒ, éshwóŋte na gù, tà mbɔɔ páʼ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzsé jú pɔ́ ngie yɛ̌ mmó áa mbòŋ.
en: Therefore, do not let your good be slandered,

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, anò lefùɔ Ssé té nò shúm léjÿó kà nò melùʼ wɔ́ɔ wɔ́. Anò lefùɔ Ssé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ légÿo menò mie é fóo mbwó Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a. Á gwɔ́ pɔ́ légÿo menò mie ée ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò Ssé, ńgwɔ́ lénéŋe lé sẅéte, ńgwɔ́ lénéŋe né lekág.
en: for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking,   but righteousness, peace, and joy  # 14:17 Rm 15:13; Gl 5:22 in the Holy Spirit.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn faʼa fàʼ Keleto lé yɔɔn ntí, mbà nò yé ge poŋ Ssé, epʉ̀a mesoŋ piŋ ńná mekùʼ ngàŋ.
en: Whoever serves Christ   in this way is acceptable to God and receives human approval.  # 14:18 2Co 8:21; Php 4:8; 1Pt 2:12

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pege faʼa mmó gie á ge gÿo pege néŋe lé mbʉ́lè, ḿbiŋ ńkẅiʼi ńtóonte mennɛ́ mégè na lezǎb ntʉ́m na Ssé.
en: So then, let us pursue what promotes peace   and what builds up one another.  # 14:19 Rm 15:2; 1Co 10:23; 14:3,26; 2Co 12:19; Eph 4:12,29

ngiemboon: Te cʉŋte fàʼa Ssé ńtí nò mmó léjÿó. Áa nénʉ́ ngie ncÿǒ té puʼ ssé ńgwɔ́ na tsɔ́ mmó léjÿó wɔ́, táʼ, á pÿɔ́gɔ na nyìŋ léjÿó tsɔ́ mmó gie pʉ̀a ge gyá, é kwɔɔnte mǒ gwe ssé.
en: Do not tear down God’s work because of food. Everything is clean, but it is wrong to make someone fall by what he eats.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie áa mbòŋ, aa lélʉʼʉ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie ngwɔ́ fɛ̌ gù kwɔɔnte mǒ, ńgwe ssé, kà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ lépfɛ́ mbab wɔ́ɔ, kà lénú melùʼ wɔ́ɔ.
en: It is a good thing not to eat meat, or drink wine, or do anything that makes your brother or sister stumble.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgʉa na sɔɔn shúm ńzsé ngie akɔ́ áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gù wɔ́ɔ, pi Ssé zɔ̌ zsé. Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie ntʉ́m wé té sáʼa yé na mmó gie à gee ngÿǒ wɔ́.
en: Whatever you believe about these things, keep between yourself and God. Blessed is the one who does not condemn himself by what he approves.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿmʉ́ʼte na mmó, á pɔ́ɔn léjÿó, ńké ńjÿó, mbà à gwě ntsaŋ mvfò Ssé. Á nue à kaa gÿo páʼ à zsě ngie nò Ssé ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwaa gÿo mmó ńne ḿmʉ́ʼte, mbà à gÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: But whoever doubts stands condemned if he eats,   because his eating is not from faith,  # 14:23 Or conviction and everything that is not from faith is sin.
